content: quote: Apple has removed a downloadable iPod/iPhone game from its online iTunes App Store in which the object is to shake a crying baby to death. The $1.19 game - one of thousands of so-called "apps" that Apple sells on its iTunes App Store - was called Baby Shaker and was taken down overnight after scores of complaints. People who downloaded and played the game said the player had to shake the phone vigorously to stop the crying sound. The game ends when red crosses appear on the baby's eyes, signifying that it has died. (....) WTF! What idiot came up with this ****, and how did this get trough the approval process? +http://www.theage.com.au/articles/2009/04/23/1240079769529.html "None are more hopelessly enslaved than those who falsely believe they are free." -Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
quote: Apple has removed a downloadable iPod/iPhone game from its online iTunes App Store in which the object is to shake a crying baby to death. The $1.19 game - one of thousands of so-called "apps" that Apple sells on its iTunes App Store - was called Baby Shaker and was taken down overnight after scores of complaints. People who downloaded and played the game said the player had to shake the phone vigorously to stop the crying sound. The game ends when red crosses appear on the baby's eyes, signifying that it has died. (....)
reply: WTF! What idiot came up with this ****, and how did this get trough the approval process? +http://www.theage.com.au/articles/2009/04/23/1240079769529.html "None are more hopelessly enslaved than those who falsely believe they are free." -Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
title: Apple pulls down baby shaking game

content: Like almost all of Apples Widgets, the iPhone Apps are uploaded from 3rd party designers. Anybody can give one of these small apps to Apple and get the fee, but the ones that Apple uses most can upload it without review. Checkout their widgets and iphone (you need iTunes for this one) apps pages and you will see what I am talking about. They are all third party apps uploaded from random companies and freelance programmers.

content: Yes this was probably one of the most boneheaded things anyone has come out with in a long time. I can see some geek thinking, albiet very misguided, that by shaking this thing people would realize how easy it is to injure a child and it would keep them safe. Ok I hurt MY brain trying to find some reason for this to even be invented. OUCH What bunch of dolts. Glad they pulled tha plug on that.
